verses.verse: Boast <WH1984> not thyself of to-morrow<WH4279>; For thou knowest<WH3045> not what a day<WH4279> may bring forth<WH3205>.
Let another man<WH2114> praise<WH1984> thee<WH6310>, and not thine own mouth; A stranger<WH5237>, and not thine own lips<WH8193>.
A stone<WH68> is heavy<WH3514>, and the sand<WH2344> weighty<WH5192>; But a fool<WH191>'s vexation<WH3708> is heavier<WH3515> than they both<WH8147>.
Wrath <WH2534> is cruel<WH395>, and anger<WH639> is overwhelming<WH7858>; But who is able to stand<WH5975> before<WH6440> jealousy<WH7068>?
Better <WH2896> is open<WH1540> rebuke<WH8433> Than love<WH160> that is hidden<WH5641>.
Faithful <WH539> are the wounds<WH6482> of a friend<WH157>; But the kisses<WH5390> of an enemy<WH8130> are profuse<WH6280>.
The full<WH7649> soul<WH5315> loatheth<WH947> a honeycomb<WH5317>; But to the hungry<WH7457> soul<WH5315> every bitter thing<WH4751> is sweet<WH4966>.
As a bird<WH6833> that wandereth<WH5074> from her nest<WH7064>, So is a man<WH376> that wandereth<WH5074> from his place<WH4725>.
Oil <WH8081> and perfume<WH7004> rejoice<WH8055> the heart<WH3820>; So doth the sweetness<WH4986> of a man<WH7453>'s friend that cometh of hearty<WH5315> counsel<WH6098>.

Thine own friend<WH7453>, and thy father<WH1>'s friend<WH7453>, forsake<WH5800> not<WH935>; And go not to thy brother<WH251>'s house<WH1004> in the day<WH3117> of thy calamity<WH343>: Better<WH2896> is a neighbor<WH7934> that is near<WH7138> than a brother<WH251> far off<WH7350>.
My son<WH1121>, be wise<WH2449>, and make my heart<WH3820> glad<WH8055>, That I may answer<WH7725> him that reproacheth me<WH2778>.
A prudent<WH6175> man seeth<WH7200> the evil<WH7451>, and hideth<WH5641> himself<WH6612>; But the simple pass on<WH5674>, and suffer for it<WH6064>.
Take <WH3947> his garment<WH899> that is surety<WH6148> for a stranger<WH2114>; And hold him in pledge<WH2254> that is surety for a foreign woman<WH5237>.
He that blesseth<WH1288> his friend<WH7453> with a loud<WH1419> voice<WH6963>, rising early<WH7925> in the morning<WH1242>, It shall be counted<WH2803> a curse to him<WH7045>.
A continual<WH2956> dropping<WH1812> in a very rainy<WH5464> day<WH3117> And a contentious<WH4079> woman<WH802> are alike<WH7737>:
He that would restrain<WH6845> her restraineth<WH6845> the wind<WH7307>; And his right hand<WH3225> encountereth<WH7121> oil<WH8081>.
Iron <WH1270> sharpeneth<WH2300> iron<WH1270>; So a man<WH376> sharpeneth<WH2300> the countenance<WH6440> of his friend<WH7453>.
Whoso keepeth<WH5341> the fig-tree<WH8384> shall eat<WH398> the fruit<WH6529> thereof<WH8104>; And he that regardeth his master<WH113> shall be honored<WH3513>.
As in water<WH4325> face<WH6440> answereth to face<WH6440>, So the heart<WH3820> of man<WH120> to man<WH120>.
Sheol <WH7585> and Abaddon<WH11> are never<WH3808> satisfied<WH7646>; And the eyes<WH5869> of man<WH120> are never satisfied<WH7646>.
The refining pot<WH4715> is for silver<WH3701>, and the furnace<WH3564> for gold<WH2091>; And a man<WH376> is tried<WH6310> by his praise<WH4110>.
Though thou shouldest bray<WH3806> a fool<WH191> in a mortar<WH4388> with<WH8432> a pestle<WH5940> along with bruised grain<WH7383>, Yet will not his foolishness<WH200> depart from him<WH5493>.
Be thou diligent<WH3045> to know<WH3045> the state<WH6440> of thy flocks<WH6629>, And look<WH7896> well<WH3820> to thy herds<WH5739>:
For riches<WH2633> are not for ever<WH5769>: And doth the crown<WH5145> endure unto all<WH1755> generations<WH1755>?
The hay<WH2682> is carried<WH1540>, and the tender grass<WH1877> showeth<WH7200> itself<WH6212>, And the herbs of the mountains<WH2022> are gathered in<WH622>.
The lambs<WH3532> are for thy clothing<WH3830>, And the goats<WH6260> are the price<WH4242> of the field<WH7704>;
And there will be goats<WH5795>' milk<WH2461> enough<WH1767> for thy food<WH3899>, for the food<WH3899> of thy household<WH1004>, And maintenance<WH2416> for thy maidens<WH5291>.
